title: Noam Chomsky: Can AI Become Sentient?
description:
Welcome to the Eye on AI podcast, where we dive deep into the fascinating world of artificial intelligence. In this thought-provoking episode, your hosts Craig Smith and the legendary Noam Chomsky engage in a captivating conversation on the topic: "Can AI Become Sentient?" Prepare to have your mind blown as they explore the boundaries of AI's capabilities and discuss the potential for true sentience within machines.

As one of the most influential intellectuals of our time, Noam Chomsky brings his unparalleled expertise in linguistics, philosophy, and cognitive science to shed light on the profound implications of AI advancement. Join Craig and Noam as they navigate the ethical and philosophical questions surrounding AI's potential sentience, raising important considerations about the future of humanity and the nature of consciousness itself.

This enlightening episode is a must-listen for AI enthusiasts, researchers, and anyone intrigued by the intersection of technology and human existence. The Eye on AI podcast continues to provide captivating discussions that bridge the gap between cutting-edge advancements and societal impact.

So, whether you're a seasoned AI expert or just beginning to explore the possibilities of machine sentience, join Craig Smith and Noam Chomsky in this thought-provoking conversation that will challenge your perceptions and ignite your curiosity.

Tags: AI, artificial intelligence, sentience, Noam Chomsky, Craig Smith, podcast, ethics, philosophy, cognitive science, consciousness, LLMs.
